snippet: Considering the value of his leaks and the N.S.A. abuses he has exposed, Mr. Snowden should be offered clemency or a plea bargain.
abstract: Editorial calls on the United States to offer a plea bargain or some form of clemency to Edward Snowden, given the enormous value of the information he revealed about the National Security Agency's surveillance program; contends Snowden was clearly justified in believing that the only way to blow the whistle on the NSA's intelligence gathering was to expose it to the public.
lead_paragraph: Considering the value of his leaks and the N.S.A. abuses he has exposed, Mr. Snowden should be offered clemency or a plea bargain.
